name: Holiday Inn Express Crystal River

reviews.text: Holiday Inn Express can vary tremendously and I feel you are always taking a chance when you book them and should research your selection first. So when I was looking to book accommodation in Crystal River for my families 'swim with manatees' I checked out this hotel on TripAdvisor. It lived up to its reviews. Friendly staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast was the usual grab and go but was hot and plentiful. Having a pool and small gym was a big surprise over UK HIE's!
reviews.title: High standards maintained

reviews.text: When I was growing up my family would stop overnight at Holiday Inns from time to time. As time wore on those places started to become less attractive to me as there were newer and more choices hitting the market. In selecting to stay at this Holiday Inn Express virtually sight unseen I took a bit of good natured ribbing from the family but that all stopped when we checked in. The first thing they all noticed is the expanded dining area for our complimentary breakfast as we knew we had to get up very early for a scalloping trip we were going on the next day. Then we got into the room and found our king sized beds to be better than those we have in our own homes. The next thing we noticed was they had both soft and hard pillows on the beds with pillow cases telling us which was which. I've stayed at some pretty fancy hotels and not felt as much at home as we did here.
reviews.title: Nothing like the older Holiday Inns we have come to pass by

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here the night before we went swimming with the Manatees. this was a one night stop during our 10 Florida vacation. we got to the hotel about 10:30 pm and the front desk employee was very friendly. the hotel itself appears to be new. Everything looked great. Our room was very nice and new. The room had extremely high ceilings which did cause an echo when we spoke amongst ourselves. The only issue I had was that when I requested a late checkout I was denied. As a platinum member IHG boasts that one of the benefits is a late checkout , up until 2 pm. Since we checked in so late we had no time to get things organized for the rest of our trip. Our tour was scheduled to be from 7-10:30 and i knew that by the time we got back to our room there would be no time for us to shower and leave. She said that they were too busy to let me have even a 12:00 checkout time, so we left as soon as we could. The front desk attendant said that late checkouts are not guaranteed. My issue is this; all the benefits that IHG offers the platinum member are subject to something and none are guaranteed. Any time I've asked to use one of these benefits I always get rejected. I just wish IHG wouldn't promote these benefits if they cant give them to their members. The cleanliness and quality of this hotel were satisfactory.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel in town

reviews.text: Booked this room at the last minute due to a change in our vacation itinerary; our folks contacted us and let us know they had booked a scalloping trip in the middle of our stay with them (d'oh!) and we needed to scramble to get a hotel. I was so pleased that we could get a room to accommodate our family on such short notice.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay and relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, I noticed a girl walking around with her friends, carrying her bottle of wine. It was a wedding party (oh, no!). Then I heard they were booked to the same floor as my family (even worse, right?!). The quality of the rooms is great. If the wedding party made any noise, we didn't hear it.
reviews.title: Clean & Comfy

reviews.text: My first trip to this hotel and it won't be my last! The staff is amazing, so helpful and knowledgeable. The included breakfast prepared by Mary (an amazing lady who could
reviews.title: Crystal River Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: run circles around me!) is a dear and works so hard to see that everyone gets a delicious
reviews.title: Fanstastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast before or after their manatee swim. The rooms are spotless, the beds are
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: comfy. Having a frig in the room is very convenient. Every employee I came in contact
reviews.title: Great location and rooms

reviews.text: with had a smile on their face, a cheery hello and was very helpful. The only surprise you
reviews.title: Great home base for scalloping and tubing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels all over the US and Canada and cannot recall a hotel where the staff are so friendly and helpful. Everyone wanted to do something for me and I almost felt guilty for not thinking of something I needed!. Fab breakfast includes cinnamon rolls, freshly made pancakes, cereals, pastries etc. Lovely rooom, HBO, great bathroom, very clean.Could not ask for more - great value for money. Do not hestiate to stay here.
reviews.title: What a friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I stay in a hotel for only one night, two things are the most important: clean rooms and nice, comfortable beds. This hotel has both, and more. The rooms are spacious, have a nice layout and have all the amenities that you would expect. There is enough (free) parking around the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice beds, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included and it has a nice selection of bread, pastries, coffee and juices. The breakfast started at 6am, which gave us plenty of time to eat before we headed over to River Ventures for our Manatee Tour.
reviews.title: does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: If we're ever in the neighborhood again, we will definitely stay in this hotel again!
reviews.title: Thankful!

reviews.text: stayed two nights here so we could go kayaking with paddling adventures at weeki wachi ( highly recommend )
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Hotel, room and parking were very clean. Beds were comfortable with soft and firm pillows to select from. They really accommodated those with 7am manatee tours because the breakfast buffet was listed as opening at 6:30 am but was open shortly after 6am when we went. Convenient to everything.
reviews.title: Comfortable pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel recently whilst in the area. We needed a place to stay the night before an early morning Manatee trip we had booked.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stop over when visiting the area!

reviews.text: The hotel was perfect for us - clean, friendly, easy to find, close to the rivers and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the 2 room suite and it was very spacious and comfortable for 4 adults ...The jacuzzi bath was a nice little treat.
reviews.title: Friendly and Professional Service

reviews.text: Our trip was at 6am and they kindly offered to give us a (free!) later check out so that we could come back after and make use of the room and shower etc. We didn't ask for this and didnt plan to but it was greatly appreciated and we definitely needed that shower!!
reviews.title: We'll be back.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Crystal River Hotel Crystal River
description: Crystal River s Newest Hotel for Business, Leisure and Eco-Travelers Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Crystal River! Our modern, green friendly and smoke free hotel is located in the charming city of Crystal River, FL. Near the intersection of Hwy 19 and Hwy 44, the hotel is located East of Inverness, FL, North of Tampa, FL and West of Orlando, FL.Situated in Citrus County, Crystal River is a nature lover's dream and best known for having the world's highest concentration of manatees visiting the area's spring fed waters. The hotel is close to the Nature Coast s beautiful Eco-attractions that offer canoeing, kayaking, fishing, hiking or trail riding all available at Crystal River Preserve State Park. Visitors can take advantage of swimming, snorkeling or diving with manatees in Kings Springs or relaxing on Ft. Island Gulf Beach. The hotel is minutes from Progress Energy Nuclear Power Plant, Seven Rivers Regional Medical Center, Citrus Memorial Hospital and Simon Crystal River Mall. Enjoy premium amenities during your stay with us. Families will enjoy our spacious double king guest rooms with their choice of color theme. Business travelers can utilize our Crystal Meeting Room equipped with audio/visual equipment, accommodating up to 66 people. Be sure to check Crystal River, FL off of your list of the 1000 Places To See Before You Die. Our staff will make you feel so special, you won t want to leave!
